IN THE COURT OF THE SESSIONS JUDGE,
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
PRESENT : SMT. NAZEERA. S, SESSIONS JUDGE
Tuesday, the 4" day of March, 2025/ 13" day of Phalguna, 1946
CRIMINAL M.C. No.622/2025
(Crime No.132/2025 of Chirayinkeezhu Police Station)
Petitioners/Accused Nos. 1 and 3:-
1. Askhay A.S, aged 28 years,
S/o Ajaykumar, Sahridaya Sadanam,
Kodumam, Attingal P.O,
Thiruvananthapuram
2. Muraleedharan Nair,
S/o Vasudevan Pillai, Radhalayam,
Valiyayila Thottuvaram,
Chirayinkeezhu P.O, Thiruvananthapuram
By Advocate:-P.G. Saiju
Counter Petitioners:-
1. The Station House Officer, Chirayinkeezhu Police Station
2. State of Kerala
By Public Prosecutor Dr. T. Geenakumary
This petition came up for hearing on 03/03/2025 and the court on 04/03/2025
passed the following :
ORDER
This is an application filed under Section 482 of the Bharatiya Nagarik
Suraksha Sanhita, seeking pre-arrest bail.
Criminal M.C.No.622/2025 1/7

2. The petitioners are alleged to have committed the offences punishable
under Sections 115(2), 118(1), 74, 76 and 324(2), r/w Section 3(5) of the
Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, and Crime No. 132/2025 of Chirayinkeezhu Police
Station is registered against the petitioners arraying them as accused Nos. 1 and 3.

3. The prosecution allegation in brief is as follows:- On 31.01.2025 at
about 12 Noon, the 3™ accused, who is the neighbour of the defacto complainant,
obstructed the way leading to the house of the defacto complainant, by fixing
barbed wire fence. When the relative of the defacto complainant Sri.Ramachandran
Nair questioned the same, the 4" accused threw a stone towards him, accused
Nos.4 and 5 fisted on his back, the 1% accused kicked him down, the 2" accused
beat him with an iron bucket, and accused Nos.1, 3, 4 and 5 beat him, and when
the defacto complainant attempted to prevent the same, the 2™ accused caught hold
of her hair, and the 1* accused, by using an iron bucket, beat her. At that time, the
granddaughter of the defacto complainant came there and helped the defacto
complainant to get up, the 2"! accused caught hold of her hair, and the 1 accused
beat and fisted her and tore her dress. In the incident, the relative of the defacto
complainant Sri.Ramachandran Nair lost his mobile phone, causing a loss of
Rs.1,700/-.

Criminal M.C.No.622/2025 2/7

4. Notice in this bail application is issued to the Public Prosecutor. The
Investigating Officer filed report opposing the anticipatory bail application.

5. Heard. Perused the records.

6. The only point to be considered is, whether an order of anticipatory
bail can be granted to the petitioners/accused Nos. 1 and 3.

7. The Point: The 2™ petitioner/ 3 accused is the uncle of 1*
petitioner / 1* accused. The defacto complainant is the neighbour of the
petitioners. The petitioners along with the other accused are alleged to have
assaulted the defacto complainant, her grand daughter and her relative. The
motive alleged is the animosity due to a dispute between the defacto complainant
and the petitioners in connection with the pathway, leading to the house of the
defacto complainant.

8. The petitioners submitted that, the defacto complainant is residing on
the immediate southern side of the property owned by the 2™ petitioner, and for
the ingress and egress of the defacto complainant and her family members, a
pathway having an extent of 3 links is located on the south-eastern side of the said
property. It is submitted that, on several times, the defacto complainant and her
men tried to extend the width of the pathway, and the defacto complainant also
obstructed the construction of boundary wall, separating the pathway and the

Criminal M.C.No.622/2025 3/7

property of the 2™ petitioner. The petitioners also submitted that, on 30.12.2024,
while the family members were engaged in fencing the boundary of the said
property, the defacto complainant along with one Ramachandran Nair reached
there and threw away the boundary stone and the iron fencing, and attacked the
petitioners and they sustained injuries in the incident and took treatment from
various hospitals, and thereafter, a false case has been foisted against the
petitioners. According to the petitioners, they are innocent of the allegations
levelled against them and they have not committed any offence as alleged.

9. There is serious allegation as against the petitioners. However, it is
significant to note that the alleged incident occurred in view of a civil dispute. It
is seen from the First Information Statement given by the defacto complainant
that, on the alleged date of incident, the 3 accused had attempted to construct a
fence obstructing the pathway towards the house of the defacto complainant and
as per the request of the defacto complainant, the brother of the daughter-in-law of
the defacto complainant by name Ramachandran came for her help, and thereafter,
the alleged incident occurred. The petitioners’ counsel submitted that, in fact, the
defacto complainant and the other person rushed into the spot, while the 2"
petitioner/ 3 accused and his family members were engaged in fencing their
boundary and the petitioners were manhandled by them. According to the

Criminal M.C.No.622/2025 Al7

petitioners, the defacto complainant and the said Ramachandran had attacked the
petitioners, causing severe injuries to the 1* petitioner and injuries to the 2™
petitioner. Along with the bail application, the petitioners had produced their
treatment records from Taluk Head Quarters Hospital, Chirayinkeezhu. It is also
submitted by the petitioners’ counsel that, though a complaint was given by the
petitioners, it was not registered. The petitioners’ counsel further submitted that,
the defacto complainant had obstructed the construction of boundary wall
separating the pathway and their property, and that the 2" petitioner had filed a
caveat petition before the Munsiff Court, Attingal as Caveat No. 3/2025.
Apparently, civil disputes are pending between the two. In view of the persisting
civil dispute and boundary dispute, it appears that, an exaggeration of the case or
fabrication of the case cannot be ruled out. The learned Public Prosecutor
submitted that, it is these petitioners, who caused injuries to the victim
Ramachandran Nair. However, it is relevant to note that there was an altercation
between the two teams in view of the boundary dispute, and there is likelihood of
causing injuries in the said altercation. The involvement of the petitioners in the
alleged offence is a matter of evidence. It would be a travesty of justice, if the
petitioners are put behind the bars, if actually no offence is committed by them.
There is every possibility that the case is filed against them only to humiliate or
Criminal M.C.No.622/2025 5/7

harass the petitioners in view of the boundary dispute. So it appears that this is a
fit case where an order of pre-arrest bail can be granted to the petitioners.
In the result, the petition is allowed on the following conditions:-

(1) In the event of arrest, the petitioners/accused Nos. 1 and 3 shall
be released on bail on their executing bond for Rs.50,000/-
(Rupees Fifty Thousand only) each with two solvent sureties
for the like sum each to the satisfaction of the arresting
officer/Investigating Officer, as the case may be.

(2) Petitioners shall appear before the Investigating Officer
between 10 a.m. and 11 a.m. on every Thursday for a period
of 3 (three) months or till the filing of the final report,
whichever is earlier.

(3) Petitioners shall also appear before the Investigating Officer as
and when required.

(4) Petitioners shall not commit any offence while on bail.

(5) Petitioners shall not attempt to contact the defacto complainant
or any of the prosecution witnesses, directly or through any
other person, or in any other way try to tamper with the
evidence or influence any witnesses or other persons related
to the investigation.

Criminal M.C.No.622/2025 6/7

In case of any violation of the above conditions or misuse of liberty,
the prosecution or the defacto complainant is at liberty to approach jurisdictional
court for cancellation of bail.

(Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by him, corrected and
pronounced by me in Open Court on this the 4" day of March 2025)
Sd/-
NAZEERA.S
SESSIONS JUDGE
